comments.body: Does it work for all debian version ? (especially since the next release happen soon) ?

You're right, this way isn't reliable, packaging might evolve: instead of mimic postinst script, reusing it is better.

I removed this task and added another one which purges PostgreSQL packages if they are installed.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +64,68 @@
- name: Initialize postgres (Debian)
  shell: '. /usr/share/postgresql-common/maintscripts-functions && set_system_locale && /usr/bin/pg_createcluster -u postgres {{ pg_verÂ }} main'
  args:
    creates: "/etc/postgresql/{{ pg_ver }}/"
